Column Comment.0: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE TYPE: A material added to a fluid to perform one or morespecific functions, such as a weighting agent, viscosifier or lubricant. (SchlumbergerOilfield Glossary). Note that the function of this table may also be assumed bytheCLASSIFICATION module for more robust and complete classifications.
Column Comment.1: ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation used for reference type or code.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE GROUP: The class or group of additives that this additivebelongs to, such as drill mud additive, treatment additive, processing additive etc.Within each group of additives, many types of additives may be described using RCAT ADDITIVE TYPE. Note that the function of this table may also be assumed bythe CLASSIFICATION module for more robust and complete classifications.
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: LONG NAME: Common long name given to reference type or code.
Column Comment.7: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.8: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.9: SHORT NAME: Common short name given to reference type or code.
Column Comment.10: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.11: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.12: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.13: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.14: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.15: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.16: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.17: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
